newsitem.title: USA: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Holiday prompts price hikes.
newsitem.headline: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Holiday prompts price hikes.

text.p: Millfeed prices rose further Tuesday as flour mills increased offers while dealers rushed to buy before next week's holiday-shortened production schedule, dealers said.
The most noticable increase was in Kansas City, where rail values rose $4 to $5 per ton for prompt shipment. This prompted price increases at other locations as well, dealers said.
"The demand has picked up ahead of the holiday," said a St Louis dealer.
Later this week demand should quickly drop off as buyers depart for holiday vacations, a Buffalo dealers said.
After next week, most dealers said millfeed supplies should increase and prices ease. Flour mills increase production during the June wheat harvest when wheat is plentiful and low-priced.
